entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises in creeks and rivers in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the Western and Central Brooks range through Saturday. People in the Western and Central Brooks range and along
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 05 at 12:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rises on the Chilkat River by Friday... A heat wave will cause temperatures to soar into the mid 70s and 80s starting Thursday and continue through Sunday. Warmest temperatures are expected Friday with a greater than 85% chance for temperatures greater than 75 degrees. With these warm temperatures, ice and snow melt at elevation will increase runoff into the Chilkat River Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Saturday... Confidence is increasing that a marine layer will develop along the coast through the weekend. This could cause daytime high temperatures to be lower than areas who do not see the marine layer develop. At this time there is a greater than 90 percent chance that temperatures will warm to the upper 60s along the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Will Bring Rises to the Taiya River... As temperatures warm into the upper 70s and even low 80s on Friday, increased snow melt and glacial runoff will cause the Taiya River to rise. There still exist some uncertainty on how high the river could rise, but there is a increasing likelihood that the Taiya could reach bankfull by Friday. Looking into the weekend, there

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Thursday through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Friday will be the warmest day with a greater than 80 percent chance of communities seeing greater than 75 degrees. Warmest temperatures will occur
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 05 at 1:55PM CDT until July 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL AT LEAST MIDNIGHT MDT SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Afternoon highs of 105 to 109. * WHERE...Luna and Dona Ana Counties in New Mexico and the Rio Grande Valley of Texas, including the El Paso Metro. * WHEN...Until at least midnight MDT Saturday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Western El Paso County

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued July 05 at 1:24PM CDT until July 06 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 3:17PM MDT until July 06 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR COLORADO FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, AND 295, AND UTAH FIRE WEATHER ZONES 490 AND 491... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 05 at 3:13PM EDT until July 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values in the mid to upper 90s. * WHERE...In New York, Northern St. Lawrence, Northern Franklin and Southwestern St. Lawrence Counties. In Vermont, Western Franklin, Western Chittenden and Western Addison Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 05 at 3:13PM EDT until July 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values in the mid to upper 90s expected. * WHERE...In New York, Eastern Clinton and Eastern Essex Counties. In Vermont, Western Rutland County. * WHEN...From 1 PM to 8 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 05 at 6:45PM MDT until July 06 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one quarter of a mile at times in dense fog. * WHERE...South Laramie Range Foothills and Central Laramie County which includes locations such as Buford, Horse Creek and Cheyenne. Between mile markers 343 and 383 on I-80 and along
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
